name: Latvia
description: Latvia, officially the Republic of Latvia, is a Baltic country in Northern Europe. It’s known for its stunning coastline along the Baltic Sea, vast forests (over 50% of the country is forested), numerous lakes, and a rich history shaped by various empires and cultures. Latvia boasts a unique blend of European and Slavic influences, reflected in its architecture, cuisine, and traditions. The country is a member of the European Union and NATO, and its capital, Riga, is a vibrant cultural hub.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Latvia is a relatively small country, making it ideal for exploring its diverse landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: It's slightly larger than the state of Delaware in the United States.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Latvia has a population of approximately 1.9 million people.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is around 41 people per square kilometer.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Riga, the capital, is a UNESCO World Heritage site renowned for its Art Nouveau architecture.
quickFacts.detail: It's one of the oldest cities in Northern Europe.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Latvian is a West Germanic language closely related to Lithuanian.
quickFacts.detail: Russian is also widely spoken, particularly among older generations.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The national currency previously was the Latvian Lats.

quickFacts.label: Time Zone
quickFacts.detail: During summer, daylight saving time is in effect.

climateData.title: Climate of Latvia
climateData.description: Latvia has a temperate oceanic climate, characterized by cool summers and mild winters. The Gulf Stream significantly moderates the climate, preventing extreme temperatures. Precipitation is relatively evenly distributed throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with snow melting and wildflowers blooming. It's a time of renewal and vibrant colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the warmest season, with average temperatures ranging from 15°C to 22°C (59°F to 72°F). It's ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and stunning foliage. The forests transform into a tapestry of reds, oranges, and yellows.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cold and snowy, with average temperatures ranging from -4°C to 2°C (25°F to 36°F). It's a time for cozy evenings and winter sports.

naturalWonders.name: Skrunda Stone Circles
naturalWonders.description: The Skrunda Stone Circles are a remarkable collection of ancient stone monuments dating back to the Bronze Age. Their purpose remains a mystery, sparking ongoing research and speculation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in Skrunda, Latvia, these circles consist of over 30 standing stones arranged in various formations. The stones are primarily made of granite and vary in size. The site is considered one of the most important prehistoric archaeological sites in the Baltic region.
viewingTips: Wear comfortable shoes for walking on uneven terrain.
Bring a camera to capture the unique formations.

naturalWonders.name: Gauja National Park
naturalWonders.description: Gauja National Park is Latvia’s largest and most popular national park, renowned for its dramatic sandstone cliffs, deep gorges, and diverse wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in southeastern Latvia, the park encompasses a vast area of rolling hills, forests, and the Gauja River. The sandstone cliffs, particularly at Sigulda, offer stunning views and hiking opportunities. The park is also home to numerous caves, including the Gutmani Cave, one of the largest in the Baltic region.
viewingTips: Take a guided tour to learn about the park's geology and history.
Pack a picnic for a day of exploring.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Lubāna
naturalWonders.description: Lake Lubāna is a picturesque lake in Latvia, known for its unique water lilies and abundant birdlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the Dobele region, Lake Lubāna is one of the deepest lakes in Latvia, reaching a depth of 9.5 meters. It’s surrounded by lush forests and offers stunning views. The lake is a haven for various bird species, including the black-throated diver, a rare visitor to Latvia.
viewingTips: Rent a boat to explore the lake.

biodiversityCategory.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategory.description: Latvia’s extensive forests play a crucial role in the country’s biodiversity, providing habitat for a wide range of plant and animal species.

statistics.details: Over half of Latvia’s land area is covered by forests.
Latvia boasts a diverse range of tree species, including spruce, pine, birch, and oak.

notableSpecies.significance: A key herbivore in the forest ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Black Grouse
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of Latvian nature and a specialist forest species.

ecosystemData.title: Latvian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Latvia’s ecosystems are characterized by a mosaic of forests, lakes, wetlands, and coastal areas. These diverse habitats support a rich array of plant and animal life.
